newsitem.title: FINLAND: Marrka seen broadly unchanged year ahead - poll.
newsitem.headline: Marrka seen broadly unchanged year ahead - poll.

text.p: The Finnish markka is broadly expected to trade near its current levels against the German mark in the year ahead, according to a Reuters poll.
A big majority, 20 of 23 dealers, economists and analysts at banks and corporate treasury departments, saw DEM/FIM in a 3.00-3.03 range by September.
The markka was expected to weaken against the dollar by September, but firm versus the U.S. currency by June next year.
The poll was conducted by telephone on May 22-23 and the forecasts were collected on an anonymous basis.
DEM/FIM BY SEPTEMBER: USD/FIM BY SEPTEMBER:
DEM/FIM BY JUNE 1998: USD/FIM BY JUNE 1998:
At 1505/1205 GMT, the markka traded at 3.0175 against the German mark and at 5.0975 against the dollar.

Forecasts by Aktia Bank, Bank of America (London), Banque Indosuez (Stockholm), CD Derivatives Ltd., Davy Protos, Den Danske Bank (Copenhagen), Enso, Handelsbaken Markets Finland, Huhtamaki Finance, I.D.E.A. (London), Interbank, IVO, Kemira, Kesko, Merita Bank, Neste, Nokia, OKOBANK, Postipankki, SE-Banken Helsinki, SOK, Unibank (Copenhagen) and UPM-Kymmene.
